title: 1.1. Introduction to Templates
intro: A core concept in FieldLogs is the concept of a Template. In this Section we will introduce the concept of a Template, how to create your own and we will go into detail about all the different aspects and usage of a Template within FieldLogs.

blocks.content: Templates within FieldLogs are structured workflow definitions built using common user interface components (input fields, text, media) that allow a creator of a Template to accurately define Standard Work procedures. A FieldLogs template has additional elements that make it particularly useful for this Role. Below are some of these:

points.text: Structural elements like Labels, Tables, Forms and Loops that allow the creator of a template to give some logical structure depending on their data acquisition needs. (See more under 'Template Anatomy')
Various types of Input elements such as Yes/No, Multi-choice, Check or Free text Input to easily Input various types of data.
The ability to mark Templates as private (for your use only) or public (for sharing with others through email)
Ability to add translations of a Template for different languages. (More Info)
Add documentation and rich media to Steps in the Template to guide user executing Templates. Think of this as a way to provide detailed reference material while 'on the job'. (More Info)
Add powerful script execution that can help you build computation & external calls to other services right into your Templates. (More Info)

blocks.caption: Templates on the web and on our mobile apps can be easily recognized as a simple list item displaying the information as shown here. On the web you can view available actions by using the button to the right of the cell.
Templates list in the iOS application. The main difference is to access actions relating to a Template one must tap on a Template to access it's Action side menu.

blocks.content: Not only can you create your own Templates using FieldLogs but you can also 'Run' your Templates directly from the Web or on your mobile devices. Running a Template simply means to use the procedure defined in the Template to acquire data about that procedure. In FieldLogs, this is then called a Job.
Jobs are evidentary records of the acquisition of data using a Template.
